body:
I can confirm I'm experiencing this `SIGILL` (Illegal Instruction) crash on an embedded `aarch64` device when running a build with Vite. I was able to capture a coredump and analyze it with `gdb`, which points directly to the `@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu` native binary.

---

#### **GDB Backtrace**

The backtrace from the coredump shows the crash originates within the Rollup native module:
```Core was generated by `/home/dac/.volta/tools/image/node/22.17.1/bin/node /home/dac/free-sleep/app/nod'.
Program terminated with signal SIGILL, Illegal instruction.
#0  0x0000ffff6c6da06c in ?? () from /home/dac/free-sleep/app/node_modules/@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu/rollup.linux-arm64-gnu.node
#1  0x0000ffff6c6d93dc in ?? () from /home/dac/free-sleep/app/node_modules/@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu/rollup.linux-arm64-gnu.node
#2  0x0000ffff858502ec in ?? () from /lib/ld-linux-aarch64.so.1
#3  0x0000ffff858503e4 in ?? () from /lib/ld-linux-aarch64.so.1
#4  0x0000ffff854e9c14 in _dl_catch_exception () from /lib/libc.so.6
#5  0x0000ffff858546b4 in ?? () from /lib/ld-linux-aarch64.so.1
...
#12 0x0000ffff8582f240 in dlopen () from /lib/libdl.so.2
#13 0x0000000000ee7cdc in std::_Function_handler<...>::_M_invoke(...) ()
#14 0x0000000000e90bf4 in node::Environment::TryLoadAddon(...) ()
#15 0x0000000000ee711c in node::binding::DLOpen(...) ()
#16 0x0000000001bfcf98 in Builtins_CallApiCallbackGeneric ()
Backtrace stopped: previous frame identical to this frame (corrupt stack?)```

---

#### **Environment Details**

* **Device Architecture**: `aarch64` / `arm64`
* **Node.js Version**: `v22.17.1`
* **Yarn Version**: `4.9.2`
* **Vite Version**: `6.3.5` (pulled in by `^6.0.5`)
* **Rollup Version**: `4.46.2` (as a dependency of Vite)
* **Native Package**: `@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu@4.46.2`

> 
> I can confirm I'm experiencing this `SIGILL` (Illegal Instruction) crash on an embedded `aarch64` device when running a build with Vite. I was able to capture a coredump and analyze it with `gdb`, which points directly to the `@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu` native binary.
> 
> ---
> 
> #### **GDB Backtrace**
> 
> The backtrace from the coredump shows the crash originates within the Rollup native module:
> ```Core was generated by `/home/dac/.volta/tools/image/node/22.17.1/bin/node /home/dac/free-sleep/app/nod'.
> Program terminated with signal SIGILL, Illegal instruction.
> #0  0x0000ffff6c6da06c in ?? () from /home/dac/free-sleep/app/node_modules/@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu/rollup.linux-arm64-gnu.node
> #1  0x0000ffff6c6d93dc in ?? () from /home/dac/free-sleep/app/node_modules/@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu/rollup.linux-arm64-gnu.node
> #2  0x0000ffff858502ec in ?? () from /lib/ld-linux-aarch64.so.1
> #3  0x0000ffff858503e4 in ?? () from /lib/ld-linux-aarch64.so.1
> #4  0x0000ffff854e9c14 in _dl_catch_exception () from /lib/libc.so.6
> #5  0x0000ffff858546b4 in ?? () from /lib/ld-linux-aarch64.so.1
> ...
> #12 0x0000ffff8582f240 in dlopen () from /lib/libdl.so.2
> #13 0x0000000000ee7cdc in std::_Function_handler<...>::_M_invoke(...) ()
> #14 0x0000000000e90bf4 in node::Environment::TryLoadAddon(...) ()
> #15 0x0000000000ee711c in node::binding::DLOpen(...) ()
> #16 0x0000000001bfcf98 in Builtins_CallApiCallbackGeneric ()
> Backtrace stopped: previous frame identical to this frame (corrupt stack?)```
> 
> ---
> 
> #### **Environment Details**
> 
> * **Device Architecture**: `aarch64` / `arm64`
> * **Node.js Version**: `v22.17.1`
> * **Yarn Version**: `4.9.2`
> * **Vite Version**: `6.3.5` (pulled in by `^6.0.5`)
> * **Rollup Version**: `4.46.2` (as a dependency of Vite)
> * **Native Package**: `@rollup/rollup-linux-arm64-gnu@4.46.2`

This Error is appear when i use latest rollup version, when i try one previous version (e.g. 4.44), this Error is NOT appear.

```
~¬∂ npx rollup@4.45.1 --version 
rollup v4.45.1
~¬∂ npx rollup@4.45.3 --version 
Illegal instruction (core dumped)
```

Compiling swc_malloc with the feature flag libmimalloc-sys2/no_opt_arch is a likely fix.

issue.title: Fix building on ARMv8
issue.body: Because of newer version of Vite uses newer version of rollup, which is build for newer arms (i guess), the vite cannot be used on RPI 4b - issue here: https://github.com/rollup/rollup/issues/6047

issue.title: Illegal Instruction on arm64 machine

labels.name: bug: upstream
labels.description: Bug in a dependency of Vite

labels.name: p4-important
labels.description: Violate documented behavior or significantly improves performance (priority)

repository.name: vite
repository.description: Next generation frontend tooling. It's fast!

issue.body:
### Describe the bug

I'm running my project on a raspberry Pi 4 Debian Bookworm Lite. I had no problem running vite build Friday morning, but since Saturday I started to get the "Illegal Instruction" issue.

My project is a vue web project that uses vite to compile the build files.

The problem is only happening on the raspberry pi, on my PC I have no issues.

Vite version 6.0.7

Tried with some other versions such as 6.3.5


### Reproduction

Only on raspberry pi

### Steps to reproduce

_No response_

### System Info

```shell
System:
    OS: Linux 6.12 Debian GNU/Linux 12 (bookworm) 12 (bookworm)
    CPU: (4) arm64 Cortex-A72
    Memory: 7.33 GB / 7.64 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 5.2.15 - /bin/bash
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.20.8 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.20.8/bin/node
    npm: 10.8.2 - ~/.nvm/versions/node/v18.20.8/bin/npm
  npmPackages:
    @vitejs/plugin-vue: ^5.2.1 => 5.2.4
    vite: ^6.3.5 => 6.3.5
```

### Used Package Manager

npm

### Logs

root@server:/var/www/iowetea-web# npm run prod:main

> iowetea@0.0.0 prod:main
> VITE_SCOPE=main vite build --config vite.config.js

Illegal instruction

### Validations

- [x] Follow our [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/main/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)
- [x] Read the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [x] Read the [docs](https://vite.dev/guide).
- [x] Check that there isn't [already an issue](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/issues) that reports the same bug to avoid creating a duplicate.
- [x] Make sure this is a Vite issue and not a framework-specific issue. For example, if it's a Vue SFC related bug, it should likely be reported to [vuejs/core](https://github.com/vuejs/core) instead.
- [x] Check that this is a concrete bug. For Q&A open a [GitHub Discussion](https://github.com/vitejs/vite/discussions) or join our [Discord Chat Server](https://chat.vite.dev/).
- [x] The provided reproduction is a [minimal reproducible example](https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example) of the bug.

issue.title: Fix illegal instruction error on arm64 by enabling `no_opt_arch` feature for mimalloc-safe

issue.title: Illegal Hardware Instruction on ARMv8-A Targets
issue.body:
When running `vinxi build` on a Raspberry Pi 4, I get the following error:

```
zsh: illegal hardware instruction (core dumped)  npm run build
```

I can confirm that the exact same repository builds fine on an x86_64 machine and even some other aarch64 machines (tested on a M1 Macbook Pro running Asahi Linux). So I suspect this has to do something with the ARMv8-A target not supporting certain extensions adding instructions that most aarch64 targets do have. Specifically I think this issue probably is with one of the dependencies of Vinxi calling C/C++ code internally, but I wasn't able to get GDB to show me which library.

You can replicate this error by creating a new Solid Start project on a Raspberry Pi 4 with `npm init solid`, select "Solid Start" and "basic", and then running `npm run build`, which just calls `vinxi build`. It also raises the same exception when running the dev server.

body: issue still present in the latest 4.46.2 version. downgrading with  `"overrides": {"@rollup/rollup-android-arm64": "4.45.1"}` fixes the issue.
This issue has been resolved via #6055 as part of rollup@4.46.3. You can test it via `npm install rollup`.

body:
Hello everyone, i have try `rollup@4.46.3`.

```console
~/p $ npm ls
p@1.0.0 /data/data/com.termux/files/home/p
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ rollup@4.46.3

~/p $ npx rollup
Illegal instruction        npx rollup
~/p $
```

Why this happen? I use `@rollup/rollup-android-arm64` binary btw.
can confirm that the issue is not resolved in 4.46.3.
